programme.title: The Lifeguard
programme.desc: A former valedictorian quits her reporter job in New York and returns to the place she last felt happy: her childhood home in Connecticut. She gets work as a lifeguard and starts a dangerous relationship with a troubled teenager.

programme.title: Before We Go
programme.desc: BEFORE WE GO, the directorial debut of Chris Evans, follows the journey of two strangers stuck in New York City for the night.

programme.title: Uptown Girls
programme.desc: Molly Gunn (Brittany Murphy) is the freewheeling daughter of a late rock legend, and the toast of the New York City social scene. But when her inheritance is stolen, Molly is forced to do something she's never done before -- she's forced to get a job. Molly becomes a nanny to a percocious little girl, who is "eight going on forty."

programme.title: Thelma & Louise
programme.desc: In one of the greatest road movies of all time, Geena Davis and Susan Sarandon ride to everlasting fame as two women who embark on a crime spree across the American southwest.

programme.title: Traitor
programme.desc: When straight arrow FBI agent Roy Clayton (Guy Pearce of MOMENTO) heads up the investigation into a dangerous international conspiracy, all clues seem to lead back to former U.S. Special Operations officer, Samir Horn (Don Cheadle of CRASH).

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "A Fatal Attraction" - It's an early Sunday morning when a local resident decides to take a short-cut through the church parking lot. Walking past a lone car, the resident can't believe his eyes.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "The Things Men Do" - It is 3am and Deputy Torres is cruising a Texas highway when he suddenly spots a crushed pick-up truck along the side of the road. Trapped inside is the lifeless body of 24-year-old Luis Reyes.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Truth of the Matter" - Carol Moleskie agrees to go on a hunting excursion with her husband, Bob. A few hours after they enter the woods, they emerge again, Bob frantically waving down traffic as he carries his bloody wife.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Paths of Destruction" - It's a late night and a Vietnam veteran with a history of mental illness is drunk and stumbling through an apartment complex. When the police arrive, he pulls a gun and shoots himself in the head.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Needle in the Haystack" - Jeffrey Ortiz, a mentally challenged man with the mental capacity of a nine-year-old, is making himself a sandwich when he inexplicably falls, striking his head on the kitchen counter.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "A Lingering Question" - When the husband, Tao Chen, is shot to death by his wife Jun, she claims she pulled the trigger in self-defense when a drunken Tao came after her with a gun.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Kiss of Death?" - After a brief illness, 34-year old Claire Jackson dies suddenly in the hospital from massive liver failure and winds up in Dr. G's morgue.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "The Desperate Crossing" - A quadriplegic woman loved by her community is found dead in an Orlando park 150ft from her motorized wheelchair. Children find her lifeless body face down in the sand.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Dangerous Forces" - Jerra Kirby, who's visiting family in Orlando, has suddenly passed out at a theme park wave pool and the paramedics are trying desperately to revive her.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Poison Control" - Chris Schaffer has not been seen or heard from in five days. Finally, his friends find him dead and decomposed in the driver's seat of his van.

programme.title: Portlandia:Winter in Portlandia
programme.desc: It's wintertime in Portlandia. Peter and Nance struggle to keep off winter weight by cutting pasta from their diets. Candace's son (Bobby Moynihan) visits Women and Women First bookstore for the holidays.

programme.title: Portlandia:Take Back MTV
programme.desc: In this Season 3 premiere, Spyke & Iris join forces with a gang of former MTV stars to take back MTV from the Tweens. A group of frustrated college grads stage a protest on the dance floor. Sandra has a crush on a man in her meditation class.

programme.title: Portlandia:Missionaries
programme.desc: The Mayor sends Fred and Carrie on a door-to-door mission to Seattle to recruit new citizens for Portland. A pedicab driver hustles for clients. Peter and Nance prepare for the opening of their Bed and Breakfast with a visit to The Doily Shoppe.

programme.title: Portlandia:Nina's Birthday
programme.desc: Nina goes to great lengths to throw an extravagant 32nd birthday party for herself. The daylong event is set to include activities ranging from horseback rides to sunrise yoga that will last well into the night.

programme.title: Portlandia:Aquiggleman
programme.desc: Concerned parents Brendan and Michelle start a band that makes kids music. The Portland Nerd Council issues a Public Service Announcement. Malcolm & Kris have an uncomfortable lunch at a vegan restaurant. The Feminist Bookstore hosts a comedy night.

programme.title: Portlandia:Off the Grid
programme.desc: Following an environmental scandal, The Mayor steps down from office and moves off the grid. A dolphin discovers that plastic bags have been banned in Portland. Musicians compete in a Battle of the Gentle Bands.

programme.title: Portlandia:The Temp
programme.desc: A temp worker hopes to turn her gig as Interim Mayor of Portland into a full-time job with Fred and Carrie's help. A wedding is interrupted. Local baristas draft a coffee shop manifesto. Kath and Dave struggle to find a table at a restaurant.

programme.title: Portlandia:Soft Opening
programme.desc: Peter and Nance practice hosting friends at the "Soft Opening" of their Bed and Breakfast. A magazine features a local furniture maker in their "Man Issue." Steampunks attend a convention. Fred takes a love interest on a bold third date.

programme.title: Portlandia:Alexandra
programme.desc: The City of Portland is overrun with art projects. Fred and Carrie's relationship is complicated by their roommate, Alexandra. A movie theater sells artisanal concessions. The consultants from "Japanese Toys, Cool Offices" get to work.

programme.title: Portlandia:No-Fo-O-Fo-Bridge
programme.desc: The Rats decide to move out of their newly gentrified neighborhood. First-time parents read various child-rearing books. Gahvin and his girlfriend go to the movies. Carrie and Alexandra have dinner at a communal table.

programme.title: Portlandia:Blackout
programme.desc: Electricity is shut off for the entire City of Portland due to unpaid bills at the Mayor's Office. Peter and Nance have a mysterious guest at their bed and breakfast. Kath and Dave go into survival mode.

programme.title: Portlandia:Sharing Finances
programme.desc: A young woman (Kirsten Dunst) is haunted by very informed ghosts. Doug and Claire make a big commitment to one another. Kath and Dave make the most of fifteen minutes. Sandra finally finds a soulmate. Fred is visited by a Date Fact Checker.

programme.title: Portlandia:Ecoterrorists
programme.desc: Ecoterrorists (including Olivia Wilde) protest animal testing at makeup company. Bryce and Lisa Rent it Out! Toni and Candace have a car wash. Fred misses hip hop.

programme.title: Portlandia:Celery
programme.desc: A celery salesman (Steve Buscemi) goes to great lengths to get celery back on the table. 911 dispatchers assure callers that it's beets. The Order Grill is open for lunch. Carrie declares social bankruptcy.

programme.title: Portlandia:Winter in Portlandia
programme.desc: It's wintertime in Portlandia. Peter and Nance struggle to keep off winter weight by cutting pasta from their diets. Candace's son (Bobby Moynihan) visits Women and Women First bookstore for the holidays.

programme.title: Portlandia:Take Back MTV
programme.desc: In this Season 3 premiere, Spyke & Iris join forces with a gang of former MTV stars to take back MTV from the Tweens. A group of frustrated college grads stage a protest on the dance floor. Sandra has a crush on a man in her meditation class.

programme.title: Portlandia:Missionaries
programme.desc: The Mayor sends Fred and Carrie on a door-to-door mission to Seattle to recruit new citizens for Portland. A pedicab driver hustles for clients. Peter and Nance prepare for the opening of their Bed and Breakfast with a visit to The Doily Shoppe.

programme.title: Portlandia:Nina's Birthday
programme.desc: Nina goes to great lengths to throw an extravagant 32nd birthday party for herself. The daylong event is set to include activities ranging from horseback rides to sunrise yoga that will last well into the night.

programme.title: Portlandia:Aquiggleman
programme.desc: Concerned parents Brendan and Michelle start a band that makes kids music. The Portland Nerd Council issues a Public Service Announcement. Malcolm & Kris have an uncomfortable lunch at a vegan restaurant. The Feminist Bookstore hosts a comedy night.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Dan St. Paul - Mockin' the Suburbs
programme.desc: Thirty year comedy veteran Dan St. Paul jokes about acting his age, his Italian heritage, and slowly becoming a cylinder the older he gets.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Aaron Woodall - Sad and Needy
programme.desc: Between his first and second special, Aaron Woodalls perspective transitioned from a nice young man coming to grips with a dirty, cynical world to a deeper introspection of his own upbringing and biases.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Scott Long - Life in Flyover Country
programme.desc: Scott Long tosses out sharp and clever lines that remind you of the differences between funny people and true comedic artists.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Bob Zany - I Think I Handled That Well
programme.desc: He simply reaches into a bottomless grab bag of jokes, so smooth and effortless that it would be easy to overlook just how much talent and skill is behind the process'"

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Sid Davis - Baggage Claim
programme.desc: This former airline worker hilariously unloads side-splitting baggage on stage. Sid's humor is fueled with A.D.D., a wavering ego, and a grade school teacher wife who views him as a child left behind.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Steve Soelberg - Pirate Hymns
programme.desc: Steve Soelberg might actually be a human ray of sunshine. Riffing on his ultra-conservative upbringing, this special balances jokes about the tune of church hymns with hilarious observations of the seemingly mundane.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Michael Palascak - 1984
programme.desc: Michael Palascak's dry humor shines with riffs on interviewing for a pyramid scheme, living with his parents after college, and how life is way better now than in 1984.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Chelle T - It Just Got Real
programme.desc: As a mother of seven, Chelle T has seen it all, and shes not afraid to joke about it. Quippy and honest, Chelle T talks about how children are raised differently these days, menopause, being married for twenty-three years, and how desperate you sometimes become when youre a mom in this special.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Brian Bates - Uber Important
programme.desc: Turning to comedy after twenty years in corporate America, Brian Bates jokes about ubering his hecklers home, meeting women while hiking, and people who dont believe in God but do believe in wrestling.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Jeff Capri - Capricious
programme.desc: Jeff Capri uses his cynical perspective to riff on oxygen bars, playing darts to get in shape, and men taking their shirts off before fights.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Maija DiGiorgio - Maija Pinion
programme.desc: Born to a black mother and an Italian father in New York City, Maija Digiorgios comedy centers on the examination of her own mixed-race identity. Digiorgio riffs on Thanksgiving with each side of her family, gender roles between the two cultlures, and her racist grandma in this special.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Brad Trackman - Thanks
programme.desc: Brad Trackman is a national touring comedian who has been featured on a number of well-known comedy shows and channels.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Max Dolcelli - Funny is All Around Us
programme.desc: New York comedian Max Dolcelli uses his cynacism and enigmatic stage presence to riff on Waze, Dollar Store pregnancy tests, and how horrible toys were when he was a kid.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Jesse Egan - That's the Spirit
programme.desc: San Diego native Jesse Egan jokes about hitting on women in a smart car, hippie drive-bys, and the gluten free craze.

programme.title: The Sun: Inferno In The Sky
programme.desc: At first glance, our sun seems quiet - but it isn't. It's an incredibly dynamic place, a world of extremes... On July 23rd, 2012, a massive eruption on the sun hurls a colossal cloud of solar matter into space. It's the most severe sunstorm in 150 years. Fortunately, the Earth is not in the direct path of this solar ejection. But it's only a matter of time before a violent solar storm hits us. When these clouds of charged matter reach our planet, they can wreak havoc in electrical systems. Previous sunstorms have resulted in large-scale power outages and the total loss of satellites. An important indicator for solar activity is sunspots - darker areas that are a little cooler than the rest of the sun's surface. Scientists at the Kanzelhoehe Solar Observatory in Carinthia, Austria, monitor sunspots every day. They send their observations to the World Data Centre of the Sunspot Index in Bruxelles, where other experts are trying to predict the sun's behaviour so they can forecast space weather. 'The Sun - Inferno in the Sky', presents the latest developments in solar science and offers fresh, unexpected and even controversial insights into the work of scientists all around the world.

In a brand new episode of Pizza Wars, host Nicole Russell attempts to wrestle the crown from Dr. Franken-slice in a viral pizza showdown for the ages. Will Nicole's popcorn-crusted bar pie be enough to topple Mike's bone-in "Flaming Cowboy"? Only pizza pros Mark Iacono and Scott Wiener can decide.

programme.title: Sean Evans and Farideh Sadeghin Taste Test Chicago Deep Dish Made by Two New Yorkers | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Can two thin-crust loving New Yorkers make deep dish pizza fit for a Chicago native? As host Nicole Russell continues her quest to become the world's next master pizza maker she must face off against Josephine Giordano of Lenny's Pizza to see if she can conquer the Windy City's most controversial culinary export. Will Nicole's chicken parm-packed deep dish be enough to the win the favor of Muchies' Farideh Sadeghin and Chicago native Sean Evans?

programme.title: The Perfect Detroit-Style Pizza with Cliff Skighwalker, Adam Richman, and Reina Scully | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Detroit is home to some of America's most delicious pizza. But who can create the ultimate Motor City-inspired slice? As host Nicole Russell continues her quest to become the world's next master pizza-maker, she must face off against chef Cliff Skighwalker in a good ol' fashioned pan-pizza throwdown.

programme.title: Mythical Chef Josh and Nicole Russell Make Taco Bell and Beef Patty Inspired Pizzas | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Pizza is the ultimate blank canvas for culinary innovation. In this episode of Pizza Wars, host Nicole Russell faces off against Mythical Chef Josh to see who can create the ultimate "mashup pie." At Mythical Kitchen, Josh has perfected the art of fast-food fusion, but will his Doritos Locos Taco Pizza be enough to take down Nicole's Jamaican beef patty-inspired pie? The choice is up to this week's judges: Complex's Speedy Morman and chef Jae Lee of Nowon in NYC.

programme.title: Neapolitan-Style Pizza at Home with Vito Iacopelli, Nicole Russell, and Daym Drops | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: It's the season finale of Pizza Wars, and host Nicole Russell must now battle the final boss: master pizzaiolo Vito Iacopelli. Will Nicole's tandoori-inspired pizza be enough to impress food review legend Daym Drops, or will Vito's "connolo-style" slice steal the golden pizza trophy away from her for good? Only one oven can handle a pizza cage match of this magnitude: The Ooni Koda 16. Tune in to a very special episode of Pizza Wars to see who comes out on top.

programme.title: An Open Conversation about Kanye West
programme.desc: On this episode Complex staffers, Khal and Jinx, weigh in on Kanye's media takeover, from his interview with Charlamagne Tha God, his appearance on TMZ, and his current state of mind.

programme.title: Joji Judges a Boba Tea Battle Between Rich Brian and NIKI
programme.desc: Boba is one of the world's most beloved beverages. But what happens when NIKI and Rich Brian decide to trick out their drinks with some crazy toppings? After learning the bubble-tea basics from Boba Guys founder Bin Chen, NIKI and Brian go head-to-head in the boba battle of the century. Gummy bears? Check. Gushers? Check. Pop Rocks? Check! The only thing keeping NIKI and Brian from achieving bubble tea perfection is the limits of their own imaginations.

programme.title: Racks Most Expensive Supreme Purchase & Air Jordan 4 Levi's!
programme.desc: On this episode Tony sits down with Racks and answer some view questions. Racks shares his most expensive Supreme purchase and break down his thoughts on the Nike Zoom Fly Mercurial sneakers and the Air Jordan 4 Levi's in the black and white colorway.

programme.title: NIKI and Inga Lam Share Indomie Noodle Hacks
programme.desc: Indomie is one of Indonesia's most beloved cultural exports. But what happens when you use mie goreng to make burgers and chocolate bars? Indonesian icon NIKI has been an Indomie purist since day one, but today she's teaming up with BuzzFeed's Inga Lam in the hopes of broadening her stir-fried noodle horizons. Together, NIKI and Ingra run through a few of their favorite ways to trick out a pack of instant noodles. Which mie goreng metamorphosis is NIKI's favorite?

programme.title: South LA's African American Taco Movement
programme.desc: Miss Info meets a group of young, charismatic African-American entrepreneurs from Watts, South L.A, and Compton who are shaking up the taco scene, finding new meaning in L.A.'s iconic street food. Find out how upstarts like All Flavor No Grease and Taco Mell are making a name for themselves, and why rapper Casey Veggies says, "The food game turned into the rap game."

programme.title: Joji and Sean Evans Review Japanese Snacks
programme.desc: Joji is here to help Sean Evans navigate the often overwhelming world of the Japanese convenience store. Born and raised in Japan, the 88rising crooner takes our host on a snack-fueled journey through the Land of the Rising Sun.

programme.title: How New Orleans Birthed a Vietnamese Po Boy Movement
programme.desc: We head to New Orleans. Forty years ago, Vietnamese migration to NOLA introduced bánh mì to po' boy country. Now, the lines between two iconic sandwiches are blurring. To find out what happens when you mash up the Mississippi Delta and the Mekong Delta, we spoke to New Orleans legend Curren$y, Times-Picayune writer Brett Anderson, and Banh Mi Boys chef Peter Nguyen.

programme.title: Filipino Food 101 With Jo Koy
programme.desc: When it came time for Sean Evans to dive head first into the menu at Jeepney Filipino Gastropub in NYC, the choice for a dinner companion was a no-brainer.

programme.title: Mike Chen and Claire Saffitz Explore Japanese Street Food and Candy
programme.desc: Japan Village is a 20,000-square-foot food hall in Brooklyn's Industry City, and Reina Scully is ready to explore every corner. But no food tour is complete without a few friends. Joining Reina on her adventure is Strictly Dumpling's Mike Chen, Bon Appétit's Claire Saffitz, and NYC restaurateur Sakura Yagi.

programme.title: WWE Star Asuka Eats Japanese Eel
programme.desc: Eel is one of the most traditional ingredients in Japanese cooking. But in the U.S., the delicacy is still largely misunderstood. On this episode of Gochi Gang, Reina Scully is embarking on an eel-eating adventure. First, Chef Hiroki Fukushima gives Reina a crash course in the preparation of unagi, or freshwater eel, at Unagi Aburi Ittetsu. And later, Reina teams up with WWE superstar and sushi obsessive Asuka for an omakase experience centered around anago, unagi's saltwater cousin.

programme.title: Frank Pinello and Mark Iacono Eat "Japanese Pasta"
programme.desc: Last week, Reina Scully ate her way through three of Japan's most recognizable ramen styles. But today, she's on a mission to see where ramen is going next. Her first stop is Niche, where chefs Frank Pinello, Mark Iacono, Carlo Carciotto, and Anthony Vitolo are ready to try mazemen, a saucy, brothless style of ramen. Chef Shigetoshi "Jack" Nakamura calls this dish "Japanese pasta"-but will his cheese and bacon-topped noodles satisfy some of NYC's most beloved Italian-American chefs?

programme.title: Meek Mill & Lil Baby Albums, Jay Explains 'What's Free' Line, Em's 'Kick Off'
programme.desc: Nadeska, Wayno and DJ Akademiks review the latest projects released by Meek Mill and Lil Baby. After dropping 'Wins & Loses' in 2017, Meek returned last week with the release of his fourth studio album, 'Championships.' The new LP, which features a star-studded line-up of guest appearances, is highlighted by the Jay-Z and Rick Ross-assisted track, "What's Free," as well as the Drake and Meek collab joint "Going Bad.

programme.title: Kanye Still Obsessing About Drake, Bobby Shmurda Dropping a Tape From Prison?
programme.desc: On Tuesday's (Jan. 28) episode of #EverydayStruggle, Nadeska, Wayno and DJ Akademiks continue to mourn the loss of legendary basketball player Kobe Bryant, and his 13-year-old daughter Gianna Bryant. The crew shares the latest updates of the helicopter accident investigation, and also speak on 50 Cent announcing that Kobe's death has made him a changed man.

programme.title: Suicide Kale
programme.desc: While having lunch with another couple, new couple Jasmine and Penny stumble upon an anonymous suicide note and proceed to work to uncover the identity of the author.

programme.title: The Walk-In Closet

programme.title: Gay Mean Girls
programme.desc: S1 E5-6 | Following low interest, Lucy goes on Jamie and Anita's podcast to drum up some hype about her Gay Prom initiative. Lucy confesses to Miranda about some important information and struggles to feel desirable. Lucy and Miranda campaign as prom queens amidst some stiff competition.

programme.title: Queens & Cowboys
programme.desc: Roping and riding across North America, the International Gay Rodeo Association's courageous cowboys and cowgirls brave challenges both in and out of the arena on their quest to qualify for the World Finals. Along the way, they'll bust every stereotype in the book. The film tells the story of five members of the IGRA. From Wade Earp, a descendant of cowboy legend Wyatt Earp and one of the best competitors on the circuit, to Char Duran, a female bull rider who's never won a buckle but seems determined to die trying, "QUEENS & COWBOYS" weaves the stories of its protagonists over the course of an entire rabble-rousing year. An unprecedented look at the strength it takes to be gay in the rural west, this film explores the many struggles threatening the IGRA and the gay community at large, how far society has come on the subject of gay equality, and how far we still have to go.

programme.desc: After inspecting storm damage to a home in Tampa, an insurance assessor simply disappeared. Thirty hours later, her body was found in a nearby river. But the killer had been careless.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A murder trail turned cold, until police got a call from a woman whose husband, Gerald Powers, had a criminal past and a fondness for Chevy Berettas.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, Grand Junction, Colorado is on edge after a series of deadly bombings kill two people and injure one more. Police race to find the culprit before he strikes again.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Lives changed in the 20 years following an unsolved murder, and so did forensic science. In time, a high-powered microscope and DNA profiling revealed a clue no one had seen before.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A lifelong resident of the tiny town of Lefroy, Tasmania was murdered outside his own home. Robbery appeared to be the motive, but with no suspects, the investigation came to a halt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1997, Kelly Eckart's car was found, with her belongings still in it, after she worked a late shift in Franklin, Indiana. Days later, her body was found in an isolated ravine.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, Derrick Duehren returned to find his Oregon home burned to the ground. His wife's charred remains were later found in the rubble.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A millionaire and his family were executed in their own home. For three years, the murders went unsolved. Finally, a box of ammunition and some fluorescent fibers revealed the ultimate betrayal.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young girl was found dead, police quickly arrested the most likely suspect. But cutting-edge technology from NASA enabled a forensic odontologist to prove the wrong man was behind bars.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It's usually easy to determine how a criminal entered the crime scene. But in this case, it was far from clear. It looked like the killer vanished into thin air...and perhaps he had.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young fireman died from what appeared to be serious but undiagnosed heart disease, his family and friends were devastated but they had no proof of foul play.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Security cameras in a casino tracked a young woman's movements until shortly before she disappeared. She was never seen again.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was one of the most unusual cases in forensic history. Investigators had to find a way to solve a murder case with evidence which consisted of a squashed tomato found at the crime scene.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Seattle police had no suspects in the violent murder of post-grunge singer, Mia Zapata. More than a decade passed before the evidence could be used by forensic scientists to identify the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Michigan State University grad student disappeared and was presumed dead. With the help of a professor of geological sciences, police hoped to get the "dirt" on her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How unlucky could one man be? His wife took her own life and his college sweetheart killed herself in much the same fashion fourteen years earlier.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, 54-year-old Gayle Isleib was ambushed in her Manchester, Connecticut driveway and shot to death. Now police must determine if love had turned into obsession... and a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 13-year-old girl went missing from her Colorado home and the only evidence the kidnapper left behind was three fingerprints on a window screen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brutal murder, lots of suspects and conflicting evidence but the forensics were clear on one thing: The killer knew his victim. And that alone gave investigators a head start.

programme.title: "On Deck" With Captain Cory McGuire
programme.desc: For someone like Capt. Cory who's out on the water most days of the year, it's easy to notice the little changes that show the stress on an ecosystem. Whether that's subtle movements of fish from lingering red tide blooms or large-scale impacts from high-volume Lak Okeechobee discharges, he sees it all, and he's ready for things to change. "I wish we would get to a point where we really put our foot down and do something about it before it's too late." Watch this episode to learn more about what's going on and to see why Capt. Cory is so passionate about fighting to protect the places he loves. Visit https://captainsforcleanwater.org to join the fight.

programme.title: The Pancakes Show
programme.desc: Few recipes deliver so much pleasure for so little work as pancakes. The batter comes together in minutes, and the cooking time is brief. Why, then, do most Americans never make pancakes from scratch?

programme.title: Easy Sheet Cakes
programme.desc: A sheet cake is like a two-layer cake with training wheels-it's hard to fall off. But sheet cakes are still cakes. They can still turn out dry, sticky, or flavorless, and on occasion they can even sink in the middle. The test kitchen decided to tackle two popular sheet cakes-carrot and chocolate-and produce simple recipes that would deliver superior results.

programme.title: An Indian Dinner
programme.desc: The test kitchen prepares two Indian favorites: chicken biryani and mulligatawny soup.

programme.title: Quicker Pasta
programme.desc: Sure, raw tomato sauces are fast, but if the sauce is watery and bland, who cares? Likewise, asparagus-based pasta sauces are often bland and boring. In this episode we keep things simple while avoiding these common problems.

programme.title: Eggs for Brunch
programme.desc: Excellent egg dishes shouldn't require the talents of a short-order cook. Our hearty frittata is just as filling as an omelet, but a whole lot easier to prepare and serve. We also uncover the formula for the ideal quiche filling and deliver a tender, buttery pastry crust filled with moist, smooth custard.

programme.title: Pulled Pork and Cornbread
programme.desc: We wanted to develop a recipe for pulled pork that rivals that of the best barbecue joints but won't be an all-day affair. We pair the pork with another barbecue classic-cornbread.

programme.title: Dark Chocolate Desserts
programme.desc: In this episode, we set out to develop ultimate versions of two favorite chocolate desserts: chocolate mousse and chocolate cupcakes.

programme.title: Favorite Citrus Desserts
programme.desc: Lemon Bundt cake, glazed with a snowy white icing, is a simple, elegant dessert. But time and again, we find it lacking in lemon flavor. Key lime pie is another favorite citrus dessert, but transporting this pie, which has a delicate, wobbly filling, can be difficult. We set out to solve both these problems.

programme.title: A Trip to the Big Easy
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof and host Julia Collin Davison team up to make a New Orleans classic, Shrimp Po' Boys. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of a Mardi Gras favorite, king cakes. Finally, test cook Ashley Moore and Bridget make a Cajun specialty, Chicken Sauce Piquant.

programme.title: Holiday Feast
programme.desc: Test cook Ashley Moore shows host Bridget Lancaster how to make a Crumb-Crusted Rack of Lamb that is perfect for the holidays. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried shows host Julia Collin Davison his top picks of electric knives. Finally, test cook Christie Morrison shows Julia how to make a showstopping Brussels Sprout Gratin.

programme.title: Smothered and Dowdied
programme.desc: Julia Collin Davison shows host Bridget Lancaster how to make a regional favorite, Southern Style Smothered Chicken. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals the best Kitchen Timer on the market. Finally, Bridget Lancaster reveals the secrets to a show-stopping Apple Pandowdy.

programme.title: Plenty of Garlic and Parm
programme.desc: Bridget Lancaster shows host Julia Collin Davison the steps to preparing the Central California regional favorite, Garlic Fried Chicken. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried shares his pick for the best inexpensive Dutch oven on the market. And finally, test cook Ashley Moore prepares an unforgettable fan-requested dish for host Bridget Lancaster, Crispy Parmesan Potatoes.

programme.title: A Trip to Tarheel Country
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof shows host Julia Collin Davison a top-secret recipe for North Carolina Dipped Fried Chicken. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of chocolate ice cream. And finally, test cook Ashley Moore makes Bridget a classic version of North Carolina Lemon Pie.

programme.title: Southern Specialties
programme.desc: Hosts Bridget Lancaster and Julia Collin Davison cook up a Southern specialty-Tennessee Pulled Turkey Sandwiches. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews paper towels. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of extra-sharp cheddar cheese. And finally, test cook Bryan Roof shows Bridget a regional recipe for Eastern North Carolina Fish Stew.

programme.title: Hearty One Pot Meals
programme.desc: Host Julia Collin Davison shows host Bridget Lancaster how to make the best ground beef chili. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews food processors in the Equipment Corner. Finally, test cook Erin McMurrer prepares a comforting red lentil soup.

programme.title: Chicken Tacos and Grilled Pizza
programme.desc: Test cook Dan Souza shows host Julia Collin Davison how to make the perfect grilled pizza at home. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Julia to a tasting of supermarket olive oil. Next, gadget expert Lisa McManus uncovers the best avocado gadgets. Finally, host Bridget Lancaster goes into the test kitchen with test cook Tim Chin to learn how to make shredded chicken tacos.

programme.title: Italian Seafood Suppers
programme.desc: Hosts Bridget Lancaster and Julia Collin Davison uncover the secrets to making perfect Linguine allo Scoglio. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for manual pasta machines. Then, gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews restaurant tools that every home cook should use. Finally, test cook Becky Hays shows Bridget how to add shrimp and seafood flavor to a riff on white bean stew.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Chicken Chronicles
programme.desc: Beginning in Andong, the spiritual capital of Korea, Marja participates in the area’s festive masked dance ritual and learns about the local salted mackerel before getting into jjimtak, Andong’s real knockout speciality. Along Chicken Alley, Marja and her adopted cousin April sample tons of the spicy stir-fry made with chicken, noodles and vegetables.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: Jonathan Eismann, Ken Goff, and Peristyle
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Steamed Clams in Wasabi Broth with Key Lim, Sauteed Fillet of Walleye with Tomatoes, and Almond and Pear Tart. Restaurants include: Pacific Time in Miami, Dakota Bar & Grill in St. Paul, and Peristyle in New Orleans.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Soy
programme.desc: Chef Staib prepares a Breaded Tofu Florentine, and a Tofu & Roasted Beet Salad.

programme.title: Martin Yan - Quick and Easy - A Light Meal
programme.desc: For those times when you don’t feel like a huge meal, let Martin sooth your cravings with these delightfully light and simple dishes.

programme.title: Martin Yan's Chinatowns - Local Culinary Guide
programme.desc: Martin tours Yokohama’s Chinatown with his friend Mr. Zeng and dines in a Beijing-style restaurant on a tatami mat. This episode's recipes include: Nanjing “Surf and Turf” Stir-Fry, Sweet and Tangy Lotus Root Salad, and Mongolian Beef.

programme.title: A Taste of History - A Tribute to Mrs Goodfellow
programme.desc: Mrs. Goodfellow was a successful baker and teacher who opened the first finishing school in America. Chef Walter Staib and Pastry Chef Diana recreate some of her most notable creations, including lemon meringue pie and much more.

programme.title: Dine & Dish Nation - 2941 Street Food Central Kitchen + Bar Joe Muer Seafood
programme.desc: Host Kam Carman welcomes John Pullum, Nashella Zarek and Alisha Moss, who review Mediterranean cuisine in comfortable surroundings at 2941 Street Food awesome burgers to elevated fine dining, such as Thai inspired Norwegian Salmon, at the Central Kitchen and stellar seafood dishes at the legendary Joe Muer Seafood restaurant.

programme.title: Graham Kerr's Kitchen - Smoked Chilean Sea Bass with Thai Vinaigrette
programme.desc: Earl Grey tea and clove-infused sea bass fillets are presented in a vinaigrette sauce of gingerroot, lemon grass, lime, cilantro and mint. Orange Roughy is poached in a citrus-spiked vinaigrette and served with fresh pineapple, hot red pepper and fresh mint.

programme.title: Hawaii Cooks with Roy Yamaguchi - A Taste of Maui
programme.desc: A Maui chef and farmer are the focus of this episode of “Hawaii Cooks.” Maui farmer Robbie Friedlander raises baby lettuce and a variety of herbs on his Haiku, Maui farm. A small operation with less than 15 acres in production, Friedlander handles every aspect of the farm from growing to sales and distribution.

programme.title: Justin Wilson's Easy Cookin' - Diabetic Barbecue Sauce & Beef Brisket
programme.desc: Join Justin as he demonstrates how to prepare and cook Diabetic Barbecue Sauce & Beef Brisket!

programme.title: What's For Dinner? Jumbo Shrimp
programme.desc: Ken and Mary Jo have a fun time in the kitchen cooking vegetables, tofu, and swordfish, plus a few other excellent dishes.

programme.title: From Scratch - Tamales
programme.desc: Today, Chef Joe gets a new custom-made knife and makes delicious scratch-made TAMALES

programme.title: The Kitchen Wisdom of Cecilia Chiang - A Legend Is Born
programme.desc: Cecilia Chiang was born almost 100 years ago in a China that no longer exists. In this episode, viewers get an overview of her amazing story from Beijing to San Francisco.

programme.title: Nick Stellino: Storyteller in the Kitchen - The Lobster Story
programme.desc: Nick recounts the time as a child that his father came home with fresh live lobsters and the trouble that ensued thereafter. Dishes Include: Pasta with Lobster Sauce / Langoustine Sliders / White Chocolate Pudding.

programme.title: Ciao Italia - Exquisite Cannelloni / Cannelloni Squisiti
programme.desc: Mary Ann prepares a luxurious Lamb Ragu to fill equally luxurious, freshly made Cannelloni. And if you’re in the mood for an equally exquisite, vegetarian version wrapped inside a lightly browned crepe, then keep watching as she combines broccoli, plum tomatoes, lemon zest, ricotta cheese for Crepes with Vegetables and Cheese.

programme.title: Martin Yan's Chinatowns - Wine and Dine
programme.desc: Martin drops into the Harbour Village Restaurant in San Francisco’s Chinatown to taste the blend of east and west cuisine created by Chef Andy Wei and learn about wine pairings with Chinese food. This episode's recipes include: Lemongrass Lamb with Minted Orange Sauce, Dungeness Crab with Basil San Francisco-Style, and Three-Pepper Game Hen.

programme.title: Primal Grill - Fired Up, Down Under
programme.desc: Grilling doesn't get much more primal than lamb on a shovel, a specialty of the Australian Outback. G'day and good grilling.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Hokkaido
programme.desc: Henry makes a comeback through this brand new journey to conquer the Land of the Rising Sun. He kicks off his great adventure in Hokkaido, the second largest and least developed of Japan's four main islands with a Japanese local. They also explore the popular zoological garden, Asahiyama Zoo, learns of rare moss balls, and goes canoeing at the Shiretoko Lake. From indulging in the beauty of the Biei Hills, to facing staggering cold temperatures at the Ice Pavilion, to experiencing wetlands ecosystems at the Kushiro-shitsugen National Park, he spends his first days in Japan with the unspoiled nature of Hokkaido.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Tohoku
programme.desc: Henry lands in the Tohoku region where he visits the historical Chusonji Temple and it's Konjikido, which literally means Golden Hall, one of the most magnificent twelfth century structures that is still well-preserved. He travels from Morioka to Sendai and learns about the art of making kokeshi dolls at the Kokeshi Doll Museum. Since Tohoku is well-known for its countrysides, mountains, and lakes, he travels to Tashiro Island and Iimoro Mountain for their picturesque scenery. As an avid foodie, he also experiences a traditional way of eating soba noodles by using green onions in place of chopsticks at a local village. He finally ends his experience in Tohoku with a stay at Ouichi Inn.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Kanto
programme.desc: Arriving in Kanto via night train, Henry winds down at the Kusatsu Hot Springs, where he experiences a unique Yumomi dance performed that is used to adjust the water temperatures naturally without using cold water. The next day, he continues his exploration in the town of Minakami through an adrenaline-pumping session of water rafting, bungee jumping and camping. Later, he travels back in time in Edo Period at the Edo Wonderland Nikko, exploring the streets of the village in their traditional clothing. Also watch Henry transform into a colorful Japanese cosplay character at the Jupiter Cosplay Shop. Before traveling to Central Tokyo, he gains new insights to railways in Japan at the Railway Museum. He finally enjoys some alone time at a Solitary Karaoke session and Purikura Shop that have been popular among young people here.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Tokyo
programme.desc: As Henry continues his journey in Tokyo, he starts his morning early at the Tsukiji Fish Market where he learns how to cut Meguro and prepare sushi with a Japanese local. They also experience eating and training with sumo wrestlers at a local Sumo training centre. After an exhausting training session, they explore some of the best of Tokyo which includes the Tokyo Skytree, baseball game at the Tokyo Dome, and batting cage. They also visit Shinjuku's famed Robot Restaurant that features exploring Japanese rock sounds, crazy dancing girls, and Japanese drum performance, accompanied by intense lighting. Henry's Tokyo experience closes at the Studio Ghibli animation film studio as well as shopping at Akibahara.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Chubu
programme.desc: Upon arrival in Chubu, Henry kicks off his exploration by hiking up Mount Fuji with a Japanese local. Later, they explore a theme park near the mountain base, called Fuji-Q Highland, that is known for its fun rides and attractions. After cycling around Hida City and having fun at the Takayama Festival, they head over to Shirakawa-go, the historical village, to experience its unique architecture and attractions. Later, Henry hears of a world of ice that never melts even in the middle of summer and insists on visiting the Narusawa Hyoketsu caves. Finally, their adventure in Chubu tones down at the spring waters of Oshino Hakkai is made out of underground water from Mount Fuji.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Chugoku
programme.desc: As one of the most well-known historical moments, a Japanese local introduces to Henry the development of Hiroshima since the war at the Atomic Bomb Dome and pays a visit to one of Japan's most exalted shrines, Itsukushima Shrine. They also explore the hidden pearls of Hiroshima Bay through oyster boat shucking. As their stomach begin to growl, they go ahead to devour the humongous okonomiyaki micky that includes six noodle servings and two cabbages. Riding on the humongous theme, they also check out a giant calligraphy piece produced on an 8m long paper using a large brush with a 30cm long and 15cm wide head. After shopping at Mizuki Shigeru Road and exploring Tottori Beach, they decide to go sea kayaking. They finally end their stay by chartering a boat offshore to watch the ocean-bound aurora where visitors bask in the captivating vision of bluish white waves.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Shikoku
programme.desc: Henry's adventure in Shikoku begins at Botchan Train. He attempts cormorant fishing during the day and visits the Dogo onsen at night to relax and unwind. The next day, he experiences the Awa-odori folk dance which is usually performed to welcome the souls of ancestors in the Bon season. Then he samples a local Tosa Tataki Dojo and travels out on boat for some spectacular whale watching.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Kyushu
programme.desc: In Kyushu, Henry visits the Kumamoto Castle which offers one of the most complete castle experiences in Japan with a Japanese local. They also discover the history behind one of Japan's most famous swordsman and ronin, Miyamoto Mushashi. Later, Henry learns more about Yanagawa punting and the antique Japanese Arita porcelain. At the Nagasaki Penguin Aquarium, they experience penguins not just by making eye contact, but by actually interacting with the wonderful creatures. They also attempt a traditional dry beach fishing method from the Edo Period by catching the unique gobble-eyed Gobi. Wrapping up their journey in Kyushu, they experience garden light illumination at a European resort themed on Holland, Haus Ten Bosch.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Okinawa
programme.desc: In his final adventure in Japan, Henry experiences traveling on monorail to Okinawa where he kicks off with a visit to the Churaumi Aquarium with a Japanese local. Since Okinawa is also known for its Tsuboya pottery, they decide to explore the Yomitan Pottery Village. With plans to fulfill Henry's lack of martial arts training, they challenge themselves to a karate training session at the place where this art was birthed. At the old folk houses of Ryukyu-mura, they experience the simple sounds of the shamisen and the locals' traditional ways of life. After admiring the limestone caves at Gyokusen Cave, they drop by Shuri Castle to discover more about the Ryukyu Kingdom. And finally, Henry wraps up his entire Japan adventure diving in the near-perfect waters of Zamami and Gahi Island.

programme.desc: Michelle and Blake love having their friends over for drinks.

programme.desc: John and Zack take on a rescue mission in Atlanta, Georgia.

programme.title: Tiny House Nation:192 Sq Ft Launch Pad
programme.desc: A hang gliding enthusiast, Brian spends most of his time in the sky.

programme.title: Tiny House Nation:280 Sq Ft Bohemian Tree House
programme.desc: Rob and Yvonne may be young but they have some evolved plans for their future.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting:An Expanding Family Downsizes in Austin
programme.desc: Austin is definitely the city for Sarah and Albert.

programme.title: Ask TOH | EV Charger, New Sink
programme.desc: Electrician Scott Caron helps a homeowner install an electric vehicle charger next to his house. The guys ask, ""What Is It?"" Then, Richard helps a homeowner install a new kitchen sink and faucet.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Thermostat, Solar
programme.desc: Roger teaches Kevin about lengths to consider when mowing the lawn. Richard travels to Pittsburgh to install a thermostat that interfaces with a smartphone to save energy and money. Ross Trethewey walks Kevin through the installation of a photovoltaic solar array on the barn. And Kevin, along with Tom, Richard and Roger ask, ""What Is It?"

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | 35 Years of This Old House
programme.desc: In celebration of 35 years of This Old House, we look back at all that's changed in the last 35 years, and also what hasn't: our commitment to delivering trusted ideas and information to empower homeowners. This season begins in Boston's oldest neighborhood, Charlestown. Kevin and Norm highlight Charlestown's historical importance, from colonial times through WWII. Our new project is part of a cluster of 1850s-era Greek Revival houses tucked into the backside of Bunker Hill. Homeowner Angela Daigle shows Kevin the period feel and features of her home that she loves, but also the outdated kitchen and poor organization of space that she'd like to improve. Upstairs, Tom Silva shows Norm the spaces that will be getting minimal work: an existing guest room, guest bath, and living room. But one level up, on the third floor, it will likely be a full gut to give Angela a better master suite with additional living space, assuming the City approves the plan to enlarge the existing dormers. Out back, Roger shows Kevin the sad state of the crumbling retaining walls. Then Kevin finds Richard formulating a plan for the basement. Norm stops in next door to meet Maggie Boone to see how she recently addressed a lot of the same issues that Angela faces by renovating her own row house. And Norm and Tom test for lead paint before beginning demo on the first floor, as downstairs, Kevin, Richard and mason Mark McCullough start digging into the project.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Brick Rowhouse Blues
programme.desc: Kevin arrives to find Tom solving a major problem with the house: The exterior walls are bowing out from the weight of the roof over 160 years. His solution: build a structural wall inbound of the brick, lash the brick to the structure with threaded rods and epoxy, and then parge the whole thing. In the basement, news is brighter: Richard shows Kevin the result of two weeks of hand digging and a week of rough plumbing. The floor is down several inches, the sewer line tucked neatly in the floor, and the radiant heat/insulation system is currently going in. On the third floor, Norm shows Kevin how the roof has been under-structured since it was originally built. The structure they added in the 1980s helped, but it still needs more. Tom joins to get the first of two massive LVLs tucked into the pockets in the brick sidewalls, and fastened in place. To see how it's holding up, Norm revisits the townhouse we renovated in Charlestown 14 years ago. Back at our house, Tom shows Kevin how he's going to open up the back wall for the new bump out. It starts with using two temporary steel "needles" through the reinforced rear wall to hold the weight of the house while a new steel beam is inserted. Then, the bricks can come down one by one to make a small new addition for the breakfast area.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | A Bridge to Charlestown
programme.desc: Richard gets up close and personal with one of Charlestown's most iconic structures-the Zakim Bridge-by talking with the structural engineer on the project, Ted Zoli. At the project house, Kevin finds the front of the building obscured by scaffolding it will be used to replace the failing asphalt roof, and also to build the dormer, if approval comes in from the City. Inside, Tom shows Kevin how he'll have to modify the old chimney for the new gas fireplace units, and they see the framing progress, including the new bump out for the breakfast area. The third floor master suite is all framed up, save the dormer, which is still in regulatory limbo. In the backyard, mason Mark McCullough presents options for rebuilding the decaying retaining walls at different price points. Then, they dig into the demolition, carrying all of the old wall material out through the house, by hand. Norm visits a salvage yard in Boston's South End that has dozens of architectural elements from the Greek Revival period, including a marble mantel and some glass doorknobs that are perfect for Angela's house. Several days later, Mark starts installing the homeowner's choice for the retaining wall: an interlocking concrete system with a bluestone cap. Richard shows Kevin the progress on the rough plumbing and electrical, including a high velocity mini duct system that will pair with an electric inverter heat pump unit to supply either air handlers or high wall cassette units. It's an efficient and quiet solution, which is perfect for this close-knit City location.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Wood and Water
programme.desc: Richard stops by the Charlestown Navy Yard to see a very special guest arrive: the last wooden whaling ship in the world, the Charles W. Morgan, which was built c.1840, just a decade before our project house. At the jobsite, Norm finds architect Sally DeGan, who shares the good news that after months of work and waiting, our new dormer was finally approved. Up at the roofline, Tom shows Norm the progress on the dormer, and how he's carefully waterproofing its low slope roof. Inside, Kevin notes progress: insulation went in a few days ago and wallboard is going up. Out back, to tie in the new work with the old house, mason Mark McCullough installs a reclaimed brick veneer on the new kitchen bump out. Kevin drops in to see kitchen designer Kathy Marshall at her studio in Wenham, Massachusetts, where she is working on the interior design details with homeowner Angela Daigle. For a more authentic look, Norm and Tom replace the fake, applied vinyl shutters on our house with authentic, operable shutters make out of durable fiberglass and PVC.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Gardens and Greek Revival
programme.desc: Roger visits the Sullivan Square Community Garden, while Richard works with fireplace expert John Sullivan to rough in the ductwork for the new direct vent gas fireplace units. With plaster work and flooring completed, Norm and Tom add some subtle Greek Revival details to the interior window trim package. For inspiration for her own urban garden, Roger takes homeowner Angela Daigle to see some the hidden gardens of Beacon Hill. Painting contractor Mauro Henrique paints the exterior window trim on our rowhouse, and puts up samples of a few bold color choices for the new front door

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Kitchens and Baths
programme.desc: Kevin finds Tom getting ready for a major upgrade to the front of the house: a new four-panel front door with glass transom and sidelights in traditional Greek Revival style. Inside, Kevin and Tom recall some of their favorite TOH kitchens over the years before seeing another one in progress Angela's cabinets have arrived from Pennsylvania. On the second floor, Tom and Kevin install new wood wainscoting to replace the worn out, poorly made version that used to be there. Norm learns about Charlestown's ancient past from city archaeologist Joe Bagley, who provides a rare look at his warehouse of artifacts in storage and testing at Boston's own archaeology lab. Tile contractor Mark Ferrante uses a marble basket weave tile from an online supplier to make a feature wall insert in the master shower. At the back addition, Kevin and Tom install a small section of copper roof to add a bit of character and long-term durability to the small roof

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Rowhouse, Lighthouse
programme.desc: Tom builds a hidden door to the basement by concealing it behind a system of rails and stiles that look like paneling. Marble specialist Danny Puccio shows Kevin the new Carrara marble island top and how they made the delicate ogee edge detail back at the shop. Angela gives Roger the news that despite a beautiful new design for her backyard, her budget is beyond stretched and she'll have to hold off on planting until next year. Fence contractor Mark Bushway installs a new PVC fence on top of the retaining wall to provide some privacy for the backyard. Richard heads out on the water to see how one intrepid homeowner is turning one of Boston's iconic lighthouses into his family's summer home. Norm and Tom restore the old, weather beaten exterior front steps with a grinder, a router, some epoxy, and a non-slip exterior paint. Stone specialist Steve Torok installs the salvaged marble mantel and surround in the sitting room

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | A Rowhouse Reimagined
programme.desc: After five months of work in Charlestown, the exterior is nicely restored thanks to a new dormer, windows, shutters, and front entry. Inside, Kevin finds systems integrator Greg Smizer test-driving the new internet-based security system, wireless music system and remote controlled window shades with solar battery back up. Norm meets closet designer Brian McSharry to see the pros and cons of designing a closet around a window. Richard shows Angela the basics of cooking with induction technology: her new cooktop relies on a magnetic field to generate heat within the pots and pans, instead of a traditional heating element. Norm meets up with Richard in the partially unfinished basement to see the mechanical room, where the systems integrate to provide comfort for the whole house. Kevin checks out Angela's new outdoor kitchen: powder coated stainless steel cabinets, a gas grill, and soapstone countertops. On the third floor, Kevin finds Angela and her mission accomplished: a serene master suite retreat where she can rest and relax. On the second floor, interior designer Kathy Marshall shows Norm the changes to the guest room, guest bath and bold new living room painted cranberry red, even on the ceiling. Downstairs, Kathy joins Angela and Kevin to see the former dining room transformed into a sophisticated sitting room, and all of the details of the new kitchen: cabinetry, tile, storage, a splashy new powder room, and the window seat addition that was worth all of the hard work

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Colonial Roots
programme.desc: This Old House kicks off the second project of their 35th Anniversary Season: an addition to a 1966 Colonial Revival in historic Lexington, Mass. With a history that extends back to the time of the American Revolution, Lexington is home to a strong tradition of Colonial-style homes that are still popular today. Homeowners Jeremy and Jody Kieval love the neighborhood but not necessarily the tall trees that hide the front of their house they'd like a curb appeal makeover that includes more sunlight and a big new farmer's porch. Inside, the front hall and dining room are working well, but the overflowing playroom needs to be relocated. Jeremy loves to cook and wants his dream kitchen to become the new heart of the home, so the nearly 50-year-old kitchen will be gutted and redesigned. Jody laments the lack of mudroom and access to the garage-but all of that will be taken care of by the new addition. All of the new upstairs space goes to the girls: the plan is to add two more bedrooms, a laundry room, and a sitting area over the garage. Norm meets architect Bill Hubner to discuss the features of the existing house, and how he's incorporated them into a plan for a sympathetic addition. In the 1980s-era great room, Richard explains why the tall room is hard to heat despite the best efforts of the baseboard and electric heat. Downstairs, the lack of insulation needs to be addressed and the heating and cooling systems may not be sized to support all of the new work in the addition. Roger shows Kevin the small stream in the backyard and the lengths that we're going go through to protect it during construction.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Footings and Foundations
programme.desc: Kevin discusses This Old House's history renovating Colonials and Colonial Revivals. The Lexington homeowners want to stay in their house during the renovation, so Tom shows Kevin how he's going to demo in phases, keeping the kitchen intact for as long as possible. Today, they'll do exterior demo only, starting with the back porch. Kevin visits a concrete shop in Amesbury, Massachusetts, to see them make the prefabricated concrete footings needed for our job. Norm explains the framing of the first floor platform from underneath, then climbs up on top to see how Tom is building the rear gable wall of the addition lying down: they sheath it, add the cellular PVC rake boards, and then stand the wall up. Roger gets underway with the layout and excavation for the new footings for the first floor addition. The new prefab footings are unloaded into the backyard, set, leveled and plumbed. Tom leaves them exposed so the inspector can sign off before back filling. Kevin explains the building permit process and the role of the building commissioner, Fred Lonardo, as he comes in to make his first inspection on the footings.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Colonial Curb Appeal
programme.desc: At the Lexington project, Kevin finds the front gable wall of the second floor up, and the roof framing underway. Around back, Tom installs a 24-foot long LVL to temporarily hold up the second floor while he adds new structure. Then, they frame the rest of the addition roof. Nearby in Lexington's historic district, architect Frank Shirley shows Norm how people have been using front porches to lend character and charm to Colonial style homes for hundreds of years. Back at our house, Tom shows Kevin the framing of our new farmer's porch and then they build a small overhang to extend the look across the garage. Inside, Kevin sees how the homeowners are getting by without a kitchen, which has been gutted and is ready to be expanded thanks to a 24-foot steel beam that will carry the weight of the second floor. Later, Tom presents a solution to the ceiling height challenge in the old part of the kitchen: a structural ceiling that will allow him to gain some height over the islands, while allowing for both adequate structure, and a clever chase for wiring.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Smart Solutions
programme.desc: Norm visits the Hancock-Clarke house to see where Paul Revere stopped to warn John Hancock and Samuel Adams of the advancing British troops during the start of the American Revolution. Kevin recaps how the roofers applied new architectural shingles to tie the old house in with the new addition. Tom shows Kevin the progress on the new back deck, and how the architect has called for a corner stair leading down to the backyard. The framing requires two sets of traditional stringer systems, joined in the middle by a hip stringer and a series of jack stringers the same idea as framing a hip roof. Kevin finds Richard and plumbing contractor Kevin Bilo fighting to keep the P-trap from the new bathtub on the second floor from interfering with the decorative ceiling of the new kitchen. They use a new German bath waste and overflow kit that allows for the flexibility needed to solve the problem. Kevin and Norm finish up the trim and decking on the new corner deck stair. For the ipe deckboards that are sharply mitered in the corner, Norm has settled on using a floating tenon connection to prevent them from opening up over time

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Making Connections
programme.desc: Roger meets landscape designer Tim Lee to see how the small stream in the backyard affects all other areas of the yard, including a patch of grass that has to be returned to the wild, and a stand of trees out front that can now be removed after careful consideration by the Conservation Commission. Before the trees come down, Roger shows Kevin the valuable shade plants that could be damaged in the process, so they're relocated to a new bed in the side yard to provide screening from the neighboring house. Tom and Kevin cut away a five-foot section of wall to connect the new kitchen to the old great room. Richard shows Kevin two common rough plumbing conditions in the kitchen: a main sink that has a traditional drain and vent configuration, and an island prep sink, which requires a bow vent in order to work properly. Kevin meets building inspector Fred Lonardo to learn how a GC can call for a "partial framing inspection" to keep progress moving on a job, as in the case with our front porch. Arborist John Marquis shows Roger the proper preparation, safety precautions, and procedures for doing a "take down" of the 12 trees in the front yard.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Exterior Details
programme.desc: Tom shows Kevin the new mudroom door and the work required to patch in new clapboards to match the old around it. Inside, two weeks of rough electrical is coming to a close as the subs call for their inspection. Kevin meets electrician Allen Gallant and inspector Alix Berube to see what goes into a rough electrical inspection. At the back deck, Tom shows Kevin how he's using a hybrid railing system that has cedar posts and railing caps, with stainless steel cable "balusters". Kevin visits kitchen designer Donna Venegas at her showroom at Boston's Design Center to see the neutrals, textures, and metallics that are currently trending in kitchens. Then, project designer Michele Kelly and homeowner Jeremy Kieval show Kevin the layout and design choices for the new family kitchen. With a house from 1966, almost anything goes, so paint color expert Bonnie Krims gives Kevin and homeowner Jody Kieval a range of options for the exterior colors

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Inspections
programme.desc: Norm and Tom install reinforced fiberglass columns to support the new farmer's porch. Richard meets plumbing contractor Brian Bilo and local plumbing inspector Donald "Duke" LaConte to see what he's looking for at our rough plumbing inspection. Kevin and Tom meet building commissioner Fred Lonardo to see what goes into the rough mechanical and rough framing inspections. After Fred signs off, insulation begins. Tom shows Kevin the storm window system he's using to enclose the screen porch, and Russell Parrot shows how we're going to heat the space: with electric radiant floor heat. Norm and Tom welcome back Fred Lonardo to review the various ways we can achieve the insulation value we need in our walls to meet code.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 9 Chefs Compete" - Chef Ramsay challenges the teams' palates in a blind taste test. In a packed dinner service, anxiety is higher than usual when celebrities Eric McCormack and Robert Patrick stop by.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 7 Chefs Compete" - The remaining chefs must prepare a dish made with king crab, with each team presenting its strongest plate to Chef Ramsay. During dinner service, the teams devise their own menus.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 6 Chefs Compete" - Chef Ramsay dissolves the teams. Now the six remaining chefs are on their own as they each prepare a dish using fourteen simple ingredients.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 5 Chefs Compete" - After a trip to Atlantic City's Borgata, where the winner will soon be a top chef, the contestants must prepare a signature dish that they would serve at the esteemed hotel.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 4 Chefs Compete" - Chef Ramsay cooks for the remaining four chefs, then tells them to replicate what he had prepared. Later, there's a surprise proposal planned for the dessert course.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 3 Chefs Compete" - The final three contestants must prepare a meal for 100 of L.A.'s finest chefs. The winner gets a TV talk show appearance, while the losers must wash and iron the linens.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 2 Chefs Compete (Part One)" - The two finalists must work with an architect to design restaurant spaces for their final dinner service competition.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 2 Chefs Compete (Part Two)" - The final two contestants square off in their last dinner service competition. The winner gets the head chef job at the Borgata Hotel, Casino and Spa in Atlantic City.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 16 Chefs Compete" - In part one of the season premiere, sixteen contestants get a shot at culinary stardom and an executive chef position in the Canadian resort town of Whistler, British Columbia.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 15 Chefs Compete" - In the final part of the season premiere, a contestant from season five returns and the fifteen remaining chefs prepare for a seafood-accented dinner service by deveining shrimp.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 14 Chefs Compete" - Chef Ramsay wakes up the remaining chefs in the middle of the night and orders them to prepare a spaghetti dinner for hungry firefighters. The losers must wash and wax fire engines.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Dillon's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay is in the Big Apple to revamp Dillon's, an Indian restaurant just blocks away from his own thriving eatery. Stubborn owner Mohammed loses approximately $25,000-$50,000 a month.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: The Mixing Bowl
programme.desc: Located in Bellmore, New York, The Mixing Bowl faces an influx of competition and barely has customers. Chef Ramsay strives to correct problems with the restaurant's appearance and menu.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Seascape
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay must work with a hard-headed chef and inexperienced owners to make some changes and bring customers back to Seascape.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: The Olde Stone Mill
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to The Olde Stone Mill in Tuckahoe, New York. Although the front has been renovated, the kitchen still serves less-than-stellar food.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Sebastian's
programme.desc: Sebastian's prepares frozen food from a complex menu and the wait staff is more concerned about auditioning for their acting roles than serving meals.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Fine McCool's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits the family-run Finn McCool's in Westhampton, New York and faces an obnoxious head chef who happens to be the owner's son.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Lela's
programme.desc: Lela's is an upscale restaurant in desperate need of clientele. When Chef Ramsay starts criticizing the menu, the executive chef sees red, leading to a showdown in front of the staff.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Campania's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay heads to Fair Lawn, New Jersey to find a lackadaisical wait staff hurting the Italian restaurant Campania's.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: The Secret Garden
programme.desc: The Secret Garden is a romantic French restaurant that is on the brink of bankruptcy. Chef Ramsay causes a stir as he suggests changing the ugly décor, the menu and the filthy kitchen.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Revisited: Gordon Returns
programme.desc: When Chef Ramsay returns to Finn McCool's, The Olde Stone Mill, The Mixing Bowl, Dillon's, Campania's and Peter's, he finds restaurants saved from the brink of disaster.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''A Rough Day on the Runway'' - The designers get a lesson on fashionable politics when they learn about the creation and longevity of American sportswear. Actress January Jones guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Race to the Finish'' - The stakes are raised in all directions when the designers are challenged to create a high fashion look and the winner receives one of the biggest rewards in Project Runway history.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''There's A Pattern Here'' - The designers take a trip down memory lane when old photos of themselves pop up in the workroom. But they are quickly brought back to the present when they are tasked with designing their own fabric and garment to correspond with a memorable time in their lives. One designer reveals an emotional secret that leaves everyone shocked and in tears. Designer Rachel Roy guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''A Look in the Line'' - The designers get an opportunity to create a look for the launch of Heidi Klum's own ready-to-wear line. The remaining designers discover that they need to enlist some help when Heidi throws a curveball at them. Designer Norma Camalli guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''We're in a New York State of Mind'' - The final five designers get treated to a night of luxury in a penthouse suite for all their hard work and making it this far. A prominent NYC figure presents the designers with the final challenge to determine who moves on to Fashion Week.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Finale Part 1'' - Tim Gunn visits the hometowns of the four remaining designers—but only three will show as finalists at Lincoln Center.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Finale Part 2'' - In the conclusion of the finale, one designer is named the winner of Project Runway Season 8.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Come As You Are'' - 20 designers must go in front of Heidi, Michael, Nina, and Tim to make a case for why they deserve one of the 16 coveted spots this season. Once they are chosen, the 16 designers barely have a chance to celebrate before being awoken at the crack of dawn with one of the toughest first challenges in the series' history. Tim wakes up the designers and tells them to grab their bedsheets and come as they are. Their PJ's and bedsheets are their fabric for the first challenge! Actress Christina Ricci guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''My Pet Project'' - This year's Unconventional Materials Challenge lives up to its name when the designers arrive at a pet store. When Tim informs them that they will find all the materials they need inside, they quickly realize that this is their opportunity to show the judges how they can think outside the box. Stacey Bendet (Alice + Olivia) guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Go Big or Go Home'' - The designers are broken into teams of two to create larger-than-life designs for stilt walkers! In the first-ever outdoor challenge, the runway show is held for all to see. Kim Kardashian guest judges.

programme.title: Una Navidad Perfecta
programme.desc: Las apariencias pueden engañar y el amor verdadero crece en los lugares más inesperados.

programme.title: Esposa Joven
programme.desc: Zehra es una inteligente chica de 13 años, con grandes planes para el futuro. Su vida cambia por completo cuando es forzada a casarse con un desconocido y millonario joven, Ali Kirman. Luego del matrimonio, Zehra se traslada a vivir a una lujosa mansión junto a su esposo y la familia de él. En medio de tanto sufrimiento, una profesora, desconociendo que ella es la madre biológica de la niña, le prestará ayuda en su desesperado intento por escapar.

programme.title: Planes Para Mañana
programme.desc: Tres historias entrelazadas que se producen en un solo día. El día cuando Inés descubre que está embarazada, Antonia decide abandonar su familia y Marian se da cuenta de que se va a morir.

programme.title: Escándalos

programme.title: Gemelos Sin Cura
programme.desc: Pedro y Pablo son dos hermanos gemelos. Pedro es un estafador. Pablo es un cura de barrio. Cuando a Pedro lo comienzan a perseguir por una gran deuda, él irá a la iglesia de su hermano para pedirle ayuda. Es así que ambos, por distintas situaciones, se verán obligados a suplantar la identidad del otro hasta encontrar solucionar sus problemas.

programme.title: Lotoman 003
programme.desc: Miguel y Modesto Marchena se enfrentan con un par de motociclistas ladrones, y luego se ponen en contacto con una agencia secreta que los recluta para una tarea: descubrir y detener una poderosa organización criminal.

programme.title: Cartas A Elena
programme.desc: Un Joven Muchacho Es Adoptado Por El Cartero. Como Parte De Sus Tareas Diarias, Ellos No Solo Entregan El Correo Y Leen Las Cartas A Los Habitantes, También Toman Dictado Puesto Que La Mayoría Son Analfabetas. Un Día Teo Queda Lisiado Y Emilio Se Hace Cargo Del Correo Y Con Gran Imaginación, Cambia Las Cartas Por Historias Felices Y Optimistas. Durante Este Mismo Periodo, Emilio Conoce A Una Joven Chica Llamada Elena Y Juntos Viven Una Inocente Amistad Que Se Convierte En Su Primer Amor.

programme.title: El Viaje de la nonna
programme.desc: La Nonna solo recuerda a su difunto esposo italiano y quiere ir a Italia. La mayoria de la familia no ve el sentido pues no recordara.

programme.title: Los Bañistas
programme.desc: Flavia -Una Adolescente Rebelde- Y Martín -Un Hombre Viudo De 60 Años- Viven En El Centro Del Caos. La Monotonía Y La Crisis (Económica, Política Y Social) Que Los Rodea Provoca Que Estos Vecinos Decidan Unirse Para Apoyar A Esas Personas Que Siguen En Espera De Una Solución. En Este Proceso, Ambos Aprenden A Vivir Con El Otro Y Descubren Nuevos Sentimientos Que Deben Aprender A Identificar.

programme.title: I'M LIVE: S1 E211
programme.desc: Joining us on this week's I'm LIVE is the Korean father of city pop - Kim Hyun-chul! Kim Hyun-chul made his debut in 1989 with the album, "Kim Hyun-chul Vol. 1." With all songs composed, written, and arranged by the artist himself, he pleasantly surprised the ears and souls of listeners with his jazz-infused music and eventually brought a new wave to the Korean music scene. Throughout his 32-year career, Kim Hyun-chul gained much critical acclaim and commercial success, earning the nickname the "father of Korean city pop." Also, his debut album was chosen as one of the All-Time 100 Greatest Albums of Korean Popular Music, thanks to the influence it had had on the Korean music scene. Then in 2019, Kim Hyun-chul resumed his career after a break of 13 years and in celebration of the 30th anniversary of his debut. The album garnered much attention not only because of the anticipation of fans and critics but also because he brought an array of Korea’s leading artists along with him. His return coincided with the resurgence of city pop in Korea, and he's back once again 2 years later in 2021 to continue with the momentum. Part I of Kim Hyun-chul's performance on "I'm LIVE" features "What's the Matter?" "City Breeze & Love Song," and "Tears of Joy." Tune in to the show and meet the legend!

programme.title: I'M LIVE: S1 E212
programme.desc: Kim Hyun-chul on I'm LIVE - Part II. Joining us on this week's I'm LIVE is the Korean father of city pop - Kim Hyun-chul! Kim Hyun-chul made his debut in 1989 with the album, "Kim Hyun-chul Vol. 1." With all songs composed, written, and arranged by the artist himself, he pleasantly surprised the ears and souls of listeners with his jazz-infused music and eventually brought a new wave to the Korean music scene. Throughout his 32-year career, Kim Hyun-chul gained much critical acclaim and commercial success, earning the nickname the "father of Korean city pop." Also, his debut album was chosen as one of the All-Time 100 Greatest Albums of Korean Popular Music, thanks to the influence it had had on the Korean music scene. Then in 2019, Kim Hyun-chul resumed his career after a break of 13 years and in celebration of the 30th anniversary of his debut. The album garnered much attention not only because of the anticipation of fans and critics but also because he brought an array of Korea’s leading artists along with him. His return coincided with the resurgence of city pop in Korea, and he's back once again 2 years later in 2021 to continue with the momentum. Part II of Kim Hyun-chul's performance features "So Nice!!," "Drive," "In My Neighborhood," and "Fall of the Moon." Tune in to the show and meet the legend!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Alone At Home
